windows.symptom: Windows photo software        Mac makes a great porgram called PictureMePro for photos on green screen. Does Microsoft offer anything for windows?
solutions: Hi my name is Ross, I'm an independent advisor. I'd be happy to help with your issue.Microsoft doesn't offer a product directly but there are several third parties which offer this type of software, one I have found:https://oakdome.com/k5/tutorials/green-screen/Regards, Ross Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.
Thank you very much Ross - really appreciate it.

windows.symptom: Asian Windows default font change to European        Hello, I couldn't find the answer to my particular question.I have a computer bought in Japan.I installed the system and Office bought here.I installed a US English language package on my computer and turned it into the "system preferred language".Still in Outlook and Work I have a Japanese font as a default font (it's either YuMincho or YuGothic).I cannot change the default font directly in Outlook because it gives me a choice only among Asian fonts. No Latin fonts.How to change that somewhere deep in the system.I have Windows 10 Home edition (1903).Thank you for any hint.Even a link to some past answer if you can find one.Warm regardsTomasz
solutions: I would advise you to reinstall the system but using the English edition which you can download fromhere.Just make sure your Microsoft account is logged into the previous install so you're registered (meaning you own a copy of Windows 10) and backup your files before installing the edition.Hope this helps!

Hi TomaszFiedorowicz1, my name is Jay. I'm an independent advisor. I'd be happy to help with your issue.Please try installing Language Accessory Pack for Office by following the procedure from this link:https://support.office.com/en-us/article/langua...I hope this helps, please feel free to ask questions and keep me on track. I will keep working on this issue until it's resolved, thank you.Regards, Jay

windows.symptom: driver power state failure        I've encountered driver power state failure on my "hp pavilion power - 15-cb012tx" and then my hard disc drive failed Hardware Diagnostic test.Are they related, can there be causality and how should I address the problem?
solutions: Hi,I am Sumit, an Independent Advisor and a 3 year Windows Insider MVP here to help.They probably are related. We need log files(called dump files) that tell us what lead to crash.Please share them with us for a better analysis of the problem. Instructions can be found here:https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...Please let us know if you need any assistance about posting dump files.

windows.symptom: 100percent CPU usage WITH NO REASON        I've just upgraded my new PC by change the whole PCThis issue was never happen to my old PC but when I use the new one this problem is always appear.I didn't open any APPLICATIONS it is just Windows 10 regular process on the task and if you plus each percentage manually it will not be equal to 100%.I thought this bug is perfectly fixed.*NOTE that my last PC I always updated Windows 10 just like the new one.CPU: intel core i5 4460RAM: 8GB(4x2)Graphic card: GTX 1060 3GBSSD:120GBHDD:2TBtoCPU: Ryzen 7 3800xMB:MSI B450MRAM: 16GB(16x1)Graphic card: MSI rx5700 xt EVOKE OCSSD:2TBHDD:2TBI tried but nothing works:1.Scanning Virus with Windows Defender2.Uninstall some programsPlease help it is very annoying.
solutions: What version/build is on the new one. Type winver in Search to check and select the top result, you can post a screenshot of quote the version and build.Are there any updates pending Settings > Update and security.Edit: have you updated to the latest available drivers from the respective manufacturers websites.?

Hi Wasawat, I'm Roshan V S, Independent advisor and a Windows user like you. Try the following methods and check after each method: Method 1: Disable Superfetch 1. Press Win+S, then type cmd 2. Right click then select run as admin 3. type the following command then press enter: net.exe stop superfetch If the above command doesn't work type this: net.exe stop sysmain Method 2: Reset Your Power Plan 1. Press Win + S then type power plan 2. Then click Choose a power plan 3. Click Restore default settings for this plan Method 3: Disable Third-Party Antivirus Software Disable any third party antivirus on your system. Method 4: Disable Windows Search This will temporarily Disable Windows Search 1. Press Win+X then select Powershell (Admin). . 2. Then type net.exe stop “Windows search” . Then hit enter 3. Check if the problem persist. If this solves the issue, then you should permanently disable it 1. Press Win+R, then type "services.msc" and hit Enter. 2. Scroll down and find Windows Search then right click on it then select Properties3. Change the Startup type to Disabled. Then hit Apply. Method 5: Uninstall flash player updates: Press Win+X > Update & Security > View update history > Uninstall updates. Then uninstall the flash player update. If the above methods doesn't help check this article by Greg Carmack- Windows MVP:https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...Do get back to us with the result. We will be glad to help if you need further assistance.
Edit: have you updated to the latest available drivers from the respective manufacturers websites.?==>Yes, I already did.
1.Did2.Did3.Did4.Did5.Can't find Update&Security on Win+XStill got 100%CPU
Sorry I miss typed. *Win+I
5.Did .Still get 100%CPU
There appears to be a recent bios update, did you include that when checking the motherboard drivers.?https://www.msi.com/Motherboard/support/B450M-GAMING-PLUSmake sure I've got the correct board.
https://www.msi.com/Motherboard/support/B450M-PRO-M2-MAX#down-biosYes, I already updated to the lastest BIOS.
Don't know if you've tried this but it might identify what is causing the CPU usage.https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/process-explorer

Hi Wasawat, You can add this as well and see if it will work. Adjust your Windows 10 for the best performance Right click on “Computer” icon and select “Properties.” Select “Advanced System settings.” Go to the “System properties.” Select “Settings” Choose “Adjust for best performance” and “Apply.” Click “OK” and Restart your computer. Thanks and regards,

windows.symptom: Bleeping noise slowing my computer        So one day I'm using my computer and I lend it to my dad. Then I get it back and now when I type on it there's a weird continuous beeping sound that slows my computer when I type anything. I can't find anything on the internet about this.Filter, toggle, and sticky keys are all off.
solutions: Hi my name is Ross, I'm an independent advisor. I'd be happy to help with your issue.It sounds like there may actually be a fault with one of the keyboard keys, causing it to be continuously pressed.Could you try a different keyboard and see if it helps? Regards, Ross
I cant, i have a laptop, the reason im able to even type this is because of the touchscreen feature

Ah ok, that does make it slightly more tricky. I do think that may still be the issue. I'd try cycling every key and trying to dislodge any debris that may be under them. It's a fairly common issue on laptops due to the small gaps under the keys.

windows.symptom: Windows Mail App: People Search Not Working Correctly        Up until yesterday, when using Windows Mail app, when we wanted to locate the email address for a recipient, we could type a string in the To: field, and the contacts in the People app would be searched for that string in the contacts' first or last name,As of toady, the search is now returning based on matches in the contact's  email address, notname.  The search for recipients of recent emails also is being based on email address - notname.On a second laptop, search is working normally.Any fix for this?
solutions: Hi jenkins-ear, My name is Marc, thanks for participating in the Microsoft Community, I'm an Independent Advisor and I'll be glad to help you today.Let's try to return to the correct operation of Windows Mail, follow the steps of the official links, if the current one does not solve the problem continue with the following.Fix problems with apps from Microsoft Store https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/402749...How to Reset the Windows 10 Mail App https://www.groovypost.com/howto/reset-the-wind...Reinstall the Windows Mail App Press Windows key + X >> PowerShell (Run as Administrator) >> Copy and paste, using the mouse button:Get-AppXPackage -AllUsers -Name microsoft.windowscommunicationsapps | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register “$ ($ _. InstallLocation) \ AppXManifest.xml” -Verbose} + Enter, wait for the process to finish, then it is recommended to restart the computer. Let me know if you have something else that I can help you with, I'd be happy to help.Happy nice day Regards, Marc M. Note: This is a non-Microsoft website. The page appears to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the site that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the site before you decide to download and install it.

Up until yesterday, when using Windows Mail app, when we wanted to locate the email address for a recipient, we could type a string in the To: field, and the contacts in the People app would be searched for that string in the contacts' first or last name,As of toady, the search is now returning based on matches in the contact's  email address, notname.  The search for recipients of recent emails also is being based on email address - notname.On a second laptop, search is working normally.Any fix for this?Hello, Try re-registering Mail app. Perform these steps: 1. Search for Windows PowerShell using Cortana or Windows Search. 2. From results, right click on Windows PowerShell and select Run as administrator. 3. Then type following command and press Enter key: Get-AppXPackage -AllUsers -Name microsoft.windowscommunicationsapps | Foreach {Add-AppxPackage -DisableDevelopmentMode -Register “$($_.InstallLocation)\AppXManifest.xml” -Verbose} Let the command complete. 4. Close Windows PowerShell and see if the issue is resolved now. Let us know if this helps!
What will "Reregistering" do?  WiIl it wipe out current mail records/folders, etc?  I.e., will it remove current mail data?

windows.symptom: Windows 10 Home in S-mode        I just bought a new Lenovo computer with Windows 10 Home in S-mode.My question is this: If I get out of S-mode, do I still have Windows 10 Home running?Or am I forced to buy something else?Thank you.Ian
solutions: Hi IanI am Sumit, an Independent Advisor and a 3 year Windows Insider MVP here to help.No, likely you would not need to buy anything. Just upgrade to normal Windows using Store and you should see Windows 10 Home.https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/90846-switc...Let us know how that goes. Content on the above blog is written by a Microsoft MVP so it is safe. However, do watch out for the ads.
Likely?

Some OEMs(very small number) charge a fee for switching out of S mode hence I said likely. However I haven't seen any case like Lenovo doing the same. They can tell better about this.https://support.lenovo.com
Great, thank you.  I will ask or look there 1st.  :)
Thank you, Sumit.A Lenovo Chat person was able to answer.  All good.Ian :)
Glad to help, Ian :)Let us know if there is anything else. Also may I know did they ask for a charge? It would help others with the same issue.

I forgot my hotmail password can't log into Windows 8        I forgot my hotmail password that logs me into windows 8. I tried to use the hotmail recovwry form but that didnt work.  If there was some way for me to use a different phone for that account i would be able to change it.  They want me to use an old phone number to receive the code, but that phone number no longer exists.  I want to change the phone number so i can receive the code to change my passwor  the form also says i have to wait 24 hours. How can i change the phone number to receive the code i forgot the password to hotmail.
solutions: We don't work for Microsoft and due to privacy restrictions/protection we have no access to your personal details to be able to assist you.How to reset your Microsoft account passwordGo to the Reset your password page._____________________________________________The account recovery form is meant to be the last option to get you back into your account. If you haven’t tried resetting your password yet, first go toWhen you can't sign in to your Microsoft account for troubleshooting suggestions. If, however, you can’t reset your password or an attacker changed your account settings, the recovery form gives you a chance to prove that you own your account. Recover your Microsoft account____________________________________________Security info & security codesSecurity info is an alternate email address or phone number that you add to your account. If you forget your password, or if someone else is trying to take over your account, we send a security code to that alternate email or phone number. When you give the code back to us, we know that you’re really you and we can get you back into your Microsoft account.____________________________________________"What to do if you forget your Windows 8/8.1 password"http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/what-do-forget-windows-password#1TC=windows-8If you've forgotten your Windows password, there are several ways to retrieve or reset it:If your PC is on a domain, your system administrator must reset your password.If you're using a Microsoft account, you can reset your password online. For more info, go to theReset your password webpage. If you're using a local account, use your password hint as a reminder.If you've tried these suggestions and still can't sign in:If you have Windows 8.1, you'll need to reinstall Windows.If you have Windows RT 8.1, you'll need to contact your PC manufacturer.@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@Microsoft forbids any assistance being given in these Forums to help you bypass or "crack" lost or forgotten Passwords.Here is the Microsoft Information outlining that Policy:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_7-security/keeping-passwords-secure-microsoft-policy-on/39f56ef0-5d68-41ad-9daa-6e6019c25d37

windows.symptom: Problem logging-in here - a warning should it happen to you.        I've had many problems logging-in since the 25th November and https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/all/problem-logging-in-third-time/6ae47b04-9ca1-43fa-bb23-e491a6832d1e   was the third thread that I created. I was interested to read this article today by Krebs: https://krebsonsecurity.com/2020/01/tricky-phish-angles-for-persistence-not-passwords/. In it he writes that "Late last year saw the re-emergence of a nasty phishing tactic that allows the attacker to gain full access to a user’s data stored in the cloud without actually stealing the account password.While the most recent versions of this stealthy phish targeted corporate users of Microsoft’s Office 365 service, the same approach could be leveraged to ensnare users of many other cloud providers."In particular, he doesn't rule out attacks on Office365 Personal (Home) users and also writes that(1) this is quite persistent and sidesteps two-factor authentication, and (2) it seems likely we will see this approach exploited more frequently in the future.For your information.PS If any of the Category/Topic etc is wrong, would a Moderator kindly move it as appropriate. TIA.

Blue Screen Error        I have been getting Bluescreen Of Death whenever I start my computer after it being off for 30 mins or more .My PC Restarts like 3 or 4 times everytime I start my pc and then runs normal I get these Error codesIQRL_NOT_LESS_OR_EQUALnvldmkskm.sysSYSTEM_SERVICE_EXCEPTIONCRITICAL_PROCESS_DIEDand much moreI updated my windows but it still gives me bluescreen error I didn't install any driver myself recently or any hardwareI hope you get my problem .
solutions: Hi Priyanshu Your Blue Screens are caused by your Nvidia Graphics card device driver (nvldmkskm.sys)The best option would be to roll that driver back to an older version, which should be more compatible than the version installed by Windows 10 updates . ..Open Device Manager (accessible by right clicking your Start Button) Expand the Display Adapters Section Right click your video card and choose Properties On the Driver Tab, choose 'Roll back Driver' Restart your PC once done . . . If that option is grayed out or does not resolve the issue, go to the support page for your device on the manufacturers website, then download and install the video driver they recommend, it may well be an older version to the one you are currently running

Well, if you get another error code after solving one, I think a reinstallation may be required.you can use this tool in order to reinstall Windows 10 with the latest update : https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-downlo...Select "download tool now" and follow the instructions.

windows.symptom: Wake timers        Hey all, i was wondering about the wake timers in windows... my pc has been waking up in the middle of the night because of wake timers, and while i know how to disable them, i was wondering if there could be any adverse effects of doing this? The timers seem to be set by windows itself for maintenance stuff. Im just worried that disabling them could keep my system from updating properly or doing its  required maintenance. Any help is greatly appreciated, thanks.
solutions: Hi ArronRest assured you can safely delete those wake timers,, that will have no adverse effects on your PC or its ability to update or run maintenence tasks, that will still happen in the background while you use your PC...
